alert.note: Alert for Calvert; St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 07 at 7:17PM EDT until September 07 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central St. Marys County in southern Maryland... Southeastern Calvert County in southern Maryland... * Until 745 PM EDT. * At 716 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Hollywood, or near Leonardtown, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Chesapeake Ranch Estates, Leonardtown, Greenwell State Park, Saint Leonard Creek, Cuckold Creek, Flag Harbor, Calvert Cliffs, California, Lusby, Saint Leonard, Hollywood, Long Beach, Calvert Beach, Port Republic, Hillville, Sandgates, Sotterley, Tintop Hill, Oakville, and Dares Beach. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail, damaging wind, and continuous cloud to ground lightning are occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
